data.title: ClientsNotReadyForFrame no OrderBy
data.body:
ClientsPlayingInFrame uses an OrderBy which shows up as being one of the heavy Linq queries in the game -
 after game initialization - mostly because it seems to be called each frame/often.

The method is called from ClientsNotReadyForFrame which is called from IsReadyForFrame.

Please consider:
a. To not order the list. For IsReadyForFrame it does not seem needed.
b. To replace Linq for a for loop.
c. Optionally to check if the client quit time dictionary is empty. Before using Linq.
d. Not call ClientsInFrame but implement faster logic in ClientsNotReadyForFrame.
e. Use an orderer array of pair for client quit time. Since it seems you never query the quit time for one specific client anyway. So best to store the list in the order needed. 

The method should be fast for as long as no or a few clients quit. However it does quickly show up as heavy.
 
1.3 million calls, 0.34 seconds spent, 0.00026 msec per cal. 


```
  public IEnumerable<int> ClientsPlayingInFrame(int frame)
                {
                        return clientQuitTimes
                                .Where(x => frame <= x.Value)
                                .Select(x => x.Key)
                                .OrderBy(x => x);
                }
```

data.title: Upgraded the RevealDisguiseOn type enum and also added a ValidTargets
data.body:
Added  a helpful update to Disguise allowing it to be
told to break under more conditions and also so a player can set a list
of valid targets to futher narrow down what Disguise can be used on in
addition to what it is allowed to target.

data.title: Proposal, 50% faster TraitDictionary
Make SpawnActorOnDeath conditional
minor perf improvement, no ToArray() in Select()->ToArray()->Select()
Calculate sync hash inside trait container.
Fix ZIP encoding
data.body:
Fixes #12985.

We has similar issues before in #10737, #10197 that were fixed by a combination of #5334, #10375 and #10332.

To ensure `DownloadPackageLogic` also gets this fixed encoding, we can't rely on the static constructor in `ZipFile`/`ZipFolder`. Instead, I have created a helper method, and we will just have to hope new code spots it and uses it rather than creating a `new ZipFile(stream)` and still getting the crappy default encoding.

data.title: Installed builds crash trying to resolve stylecop when opening the lobby
data.body:
```
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: Could not load file or assembly 'StyleCop, Version=4.7.1000.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=f904653c63bc2738' or one of its dependencies.
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.LobbyLogic.UpdatePlayerList () [0x00266] in /home/paul/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Lobby/LobbyLogic.cs:689 
  at (wrapper delegate-invoke) <Module>:invoke_void ()
  at OpenRA.Game.SyncLobbyInfo () [0x00001] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.UnitOrders.ProcessOrder (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager, OpenRA.World world, System.Int32 clientId, OpenRA.Order order) [0x008b3] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate () [0x00109] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync+<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0 () [0x00001] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1[TResult] fn) [0x00007] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged (OpenRA.World world, System.Action fn) [0x0000e] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x0010a] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () [0x00050] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x000d6] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00042] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0004f] in <21c73fe2b2f44bcbaaa7e69d79d80892>:0 
```

Happens on both .NET and mono.

I'm not sure what changed to trigger this (i.e. why this didn't crash before), but it is arguably the correct behaviour because Mods.Common.dll [explicitly depends on](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/Makefile#L122) stylecop.

The most correct but possibly not simplest solution would be to move our `--check-code-style` utility command out into a standalone executable so that our mod code doesn't need to know anything about stylecop.

data.title: Remove GPS from no super weapons rule set.
data.body: I had the unfortunate displeasure of playing a game with super weapons turned off. As a soviet player I found it highly unfair for allies to still get GPS, basically a super power in itself.

data.title: Remove ApplyToAllTargetablePositions hack from RectangleShape
data.body:
In its current form, it's bad for performance due to the `var targetablePositions` look-up happening before the `if (ApplyToAllTargetablePositions...)`, and while that would be easy to fix, fixing it only to remove the hack entirely a few weeks later would be kind of pointless, so let's get this over with.

Should go into the playtest as all mods have a lot of Rectangle shapes now, so it might improve performance.

3rd-party mods currently using this still have multiple options, so the transition shouldn't be that painful:
- Ship a duplicate of the bleed version + performance fix and use that (could even simplify code by removing the boolean and making it a dedicated shape type).
- Stay on a bleed revision before this is merged until the `PolygonShape` and/or our TS mod shape templates are finished and merged and then use them.
- Write their own HitShape trait templates. It's quite easy for rectangular buildings, not that hard for asymmetric shapes (with some practice) and normally just a one-time job.

data.title: Add IActorPreviewInitInfo interface.
data.body:
This makes it possible for mod != mods.common code to customize what is shown in the PBOG/color picker/editor sidebar.

Dependency for #13561 / #13553.

data.title: Refactor Bib & footprint cells - part 1
data.body:
This PR tries to get stuff out of the way that is easy, but would blow the number of commits and changed lines out of proportion on #13553.

Adds `ITargetableCells` interface for use in #13553, renames `Bib`, and removes the bib-related hacks from `Building` and `FootprintUtils`, while adding a `LocalCenterOffset` to `Building`, to allow shifting the actor center to account for bibs (or other visuals, if modders chose to use it that way).
Finally, moves the renamed `WithBuildingBib` to Mods.Cnc.

Dependency for update of #13553.

data.title: Lua scripting: Hunt activity cancels itself
Fix crash when loading read-only ReadWriteZipFiles.
data.body: Fixes #13557.

data.title: Crash when creating a new map when install dir is read-only
data.body:
... and the support dir `maps` directory doesn't exist.  I believe this is a regression from #13223 fixing `Folder` spamming empty directories all over the place.

```
Exception of type `System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException`: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
Inner
  Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Sequence contains no elements
    at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[TSource] (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1[T] source) [0x00010] in <26aedeede9534b948c539f8734c8492d>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.SaveMapLogic..ctor (OpenRA.Widgets.Widget widget, OpenRA.ModData modData, System.Action`1[T] onSave, System.Action onExit, OpenRA.Map map, System.Collections.Generic.List`1[T] playerDefinitions, System.Collections.Generic.List`1[T] actorDefinitions) [0x00335] in /home/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/Logic/Editor/SaveMapLogic.cs:119 
```

The simplest fix here is to add a `Directory.CreateDirectory` to the writeable-directory check in `SaveMapLogic`.  Ideally we would also show an error dialog instead of crashing if that for some reason *still* failed to find a usable save location.

This is an edge case so probably doesn't need to block our first playtest, but *does* need to be fixed before the final release.

Looks like I accidentally removed or broke in #13223 the workaround for my favorite braindead sharpziplib bug.  This prevents us from loading any packaged maps from installed versions.

```
Failed to load map: Siberian-Pass.oramap
Details: System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path "/usr/lib/openra/mods/ra/maps/Siberian-Pass.oramap" is denied.
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode, System.IO.FileAccess access, System.IO.FileShare share, System.Int32 bufferSize, System.Boolean anonymous, System.IO.FileOptions options) [0x001d8] in <a07d6bf484a54da2861691df910339b1>:0 
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, System.IO.FileMode mode) [0x00000] in <a07d6bf484a54da2861691df910339b1>:0

  at OpenRA.FileSystem.ZipFileLoader.TryParseReadWritePackage (System.String filename, OpenRA.FileSystem.IReadWritePackage& package) [0x00034] in <58dd51e179e34ef59d70cf18ab33f7c2>:0 
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.Folder.OpenPackage (System.String filename, OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem context) [0x0002a] in <58dd51e179e34ef59d70cf18ab33f7c2>:0
```

data.title: TD Balance Changes. 20172606
data.body:
The list of changes do not affect the new hitboxes of the structures. The engineer external capture was dropped currently due to the new change. Same applies to the MCV price change due to some of these changes. These changes will be looked at in the playtest and if need be after the next release.

+ Orca damage increased from 25 to 28.
Damage is increased because of their lack of damage vs armored units and structures.

+ Apache ammo reload reduced from 200 to 40.
Apaches gaining a full clip of ammo is a bit to strong. Firing the first shot starts the timer tick and will reload even if the clip is not fully reloaded. This also fixes so they don't sit on top of infantry and blow them all away to quickly.

+ Apache ammo reload amount reduced from 10 to 1.
Fixed in unison with ammo reload timer.

+ Sam now fires two missiles. (CNC95)
Does extra damage.

+ Sam range increase from 8c0 to 10c0.
Compensate for the aircraft changes. Also had a problem of MSAMs were always the better choice rather then the structure SAMs itself. This change will make them more viable.

+ Sam range limit from 9c614 to 12c0.
Makes it so aircraft can still escape while the missile won't detonate at the edge of the circle range.

+ Humvee damag vs light increased from 50 to 55.
Compensates for the price of the hummer. Having just the HP wasn't enough to counter certian builds of Nod. Enabling them a slightly higher damage allows them to kill buggies and bikes a bit more effectively. Makes them also decent arty and MRLS killers.

+ Crates got some love.

+ Viceroids now spawn.

+ An atomic bomb can now detonate. (CNC95)

+ Crate veterancy level now gives general rank instead of stripe 1.
This makes grabbing crates all the more rewarding and riskier. Such as willing to bring a mammoth tank or commando to the crate rather then a minigunner. Instead of a crate granting level 1 for units it will now give rank level 4 promoting to general status.

data.title: TraitsImplementing calls WithInterface not ActorsWithTrait(?)
data.body:
possible bug in bleed, 
depending on how it was designed to work,

background:
- TraitContainer.Get and GetOrDefault throws an exception when a trait is queried for an actor and that trait does not exist. 
- TraiContainer.GetMultiple returns an enumeration, will search the complete container but does not check if it at least finds one entry. So here the same exception is not thrown. 
- When I log all traits that are being added to the TraitContainers there is no trait added for the World actor with the name IAutoSelectionSize. tc01, tc02, etc actors seem to have it

problem:
- After changing the TraitContainer with a new implementation the game crashes with the error saying that Actor 0 does not have trait of type `OpenRA.Traits.IAutoSelectionSize'. The exception is triggered in GetMultiple - where I also added the check. 

cause:
- The check in GetMultiple in my implemention. 
- The original GetMultiple implementation that will result in an empty enumeration. 
- World being initialized where DetermineBounds is called. 
- World.DetermineBounds calling World.TraitsImplementing
- World.TraitsImplementing call TraitDictionary.WithInterface with this as actor argument.
- TraitDictionary.WithInterface only returning traits for that specific actor. 

solution:
- Should perhaps World.TraitsImplementing not call ActorsWithTrait instead? Returning all actors with that trait?
- Or, the DetermineBounds incorrectly calls TraitsImplementing 

in summary:
- i think WithInterface is called where ActorsWithTrait is meant? 
- WithInterface is also a misleading name? Perhaps better to call it with Trait?

bug:
- traits being queried that will always result in an empty result 


or is it dependent on the game mod being loaded whether an actor may or may not implement a certaint trait and therefore it is acceptable to query an actor for a trait it does not have?

data.title: Refactor Building.Footprint, replace FootprintUtils, add untargetable cells
data.body:
Refactors `Building.Footprint` loading and replaces `FootprintUtils` with BuildingInfo equivalents.

Adds a 'u' letter to Footprint that behaves like 'x', except that it is ignored by `HitShape.UseTargetableCellsOffsets = true`.

While the amount of yaml lines and custom `TargetableOffsets` it saves in the shipping mods might fall into the *'nice, but is that really worth it?'* category, the savings in TS would be tremendous, so much that I'd refuse setting up custom `TargetableOffsets` in TS and just stick to occupied cells if this were rejected.

Applied it to all shipping mods (TS will be adressed with #13464).

Depends on #13561.
Closes #13476.
Dependency for doing #13464 properly.

data.title: Add unit command bar to D2K.
data.body:
As discussed on IRC, the D2K source artwork uses proprietary layer styles that are not compatible with Gimp or Pixelmator, so I cannot complete the artwork myself.

I am hoping that @x-a-n-a-x or another photoshop-wizard can backport the layout changes to the source psd and then build some proper bar artwork, ideally IMO using some of the styling influences from around the minimap.

If worst comes to worst, we can take the artwork as-is and just accept ugly programmer art for the first playtest.

data.title: Fixes the positioning of the performance graph
data.body:
Fixes #13549

The reason why the graph is not "in line" with the ra commandbar is that the other commandbars maybe differ in size and position, so I tried to choose a neutral position.

|:-----:|:-----:|
